title: Multi-Agent System Tracking and Estimation: Iterative Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of linear systems, basic concepts of graph theory, and introductory knowledge of control theory
context.additional_context: Students analyze virtual agent systems using simulation tools and solve complex control problems through collaborative peer learning. They share learning content and exchange feedback on discussion boards within the LMS.

learning_goals: Using iterative learning control approaches, students can model distributed control systems that track dynamic leaders
Students implement algorithms estimating unknown leader inputs based on relative state information from neighboring agents
Students apply Lyapunov-Krasovskii theory to analyze stability and convergence of control systems
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
